1.text: The words of king Lemuel; the oracle which his mother taught him.

2.text: “Oh, my son! Oh, son of my womb! Oh, son of my vows!

3.text: Don’t give your strength to women, nor your ways to that which destroys kings.

4.text: It is not for kings, Lemuel; it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes to say, ‘Where is strong drink?’

5.text: lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the justice due to anyone who is afflicted.

6.text: Give strong drink to him who is ready to perish; and wine to the bitter in soul:

7.text: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

8.text: Open your mouth for the mute, in the cause of all who are left desolate.

9.text: Open your mouth, judge righteously, and serve justice to the poor and needy.”

10.text: Who can find a worthy woman? For her price is far above rubies.

11.text: The heart of her husband trusts in her. He shall have no lack of gain.

12.text: She does him good, and not harm, all the days of her life.

13.text: She seeks wool and flax, and works eagerly with her hands.

14.text: She is like the merchant ships. She brings her bread from afar.

15.text: She rises also while it is yet night, gives food to her household, and portions for her servant girls.

16.text: She considers a field, and buys it. With the fruit of her hands, she plants a vineyard.

17.text: She arms her waist with strength, and makes her arms strong.

18.text: She perceives that her merchandise is profitable. Her lamp doesn’t go out by night.

19.text: She lays her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.

20.text: She opens her arms to the poor; yes, she extends her hands to the needy.

21.text: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

22.text: She makes for herself carpets of tapestry. Her clothing is fine linen and purple.

23.text: Her husband is respected in the gates, when he sits among the elders of the land.

24.text: She makes linen garments and sells them, and delivers sashes to the merchant.

25.text: Strength and dignity are her clothing. She laughs at the time to come.

26.text: She opens her mouth with wisdom. Faithful instruction is on her tongue.

27.text: She looks well to the ways of her household, and doesn’t eat the bread of idleness.

28.text: Her children rise up and call her blessed. Her husband also praises her:

29.text: “Many women do noble things, but you excel them all.”

30.text: Charm is deceitful, and beauty is vain; but a woman who fears Yahweh, she shall be praised.

31.text: Give her of the fruit of her hands! Let her works praise her in the gates!
